00035 // Our custom FVF, which describes our custom vertex structure
00036 // These were #define'd in the book - now they are static constants.
00037 //
00038 DWORD TRANSFORMED_VERTEX::FVF = D3DFVF_XYZRHW;
00039 DWORD UNTRANSFORMED_VERTEX::FVF = D3DFVF_XYZ;
00040 DWORD UNTRANSFORMED_LIT_VERTEX::FVF = (D3DFVF_XYZ|D3DFVF_DIFFUSE|D3DFVF_SPECULAR);
00041 DWORD UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX::FVF =
00042         (D3DFVF_XYZ|D3DFVF_NORMAL|D3DFVF_DIFFUSE|D3DFVF_SPECULAR);              
00043 DWORD COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX::FVF = (D3DFVF_XYZ|D3DFVF_DIFFUSE|D3DFVF_TEX1);
00044 DWORD COLORED_VERTEX::FVF = (D3DFVF_XYZ|D3DFVF_DIFFUSE);

00049 Mat4x4::Mat4x4(D3DXMATRIX &mat)
00050 {
00051         memcpy(&m, &mat.m, sizeof(mat.m));

00055 {

00057         y = quat.y;
00058         z = quat.z;

00061 
00062 bool Plane::Inside(const Vec3 &point) const
00063 {
00064         // Inside the plane is defined as the direction the normal is facing
00065         float result = D3DXPlaneDotCoord(this, &point);
00066         return (result >= 0.0f);
00067 }
00068 
00069 bool Plane::Inside(const Vec3 &point, const float radius) const
00070 {
00071         float fDistance;        // calculate our distances to each of the planes
00072 
00073         // find the distance to this plane
00074         fDistance = D3DXPlaneDotCoord(this, &point);            
00075 
00076         // if this distance is < -radius, we are outside
00077         return (fDistance >= -radius);
00078 }

00080 //
00081 // Frustum::Frustum                                     - Chapter 14, page 487
00082 //
00083 Frustum::Frustum()
00084 {
00085         m_Fov = D3DX_PI/4.0f;           // default field of view is 90 degrees
00086         m_Aspect = 1.0f;                        // default aspect ratio is 1:1
00087         m_Near = 1.0f;                          // default near clip plane is 1m away from the camera
00088         m_Far = 1000.0f;                                // default near clip plane is 100m away from the camera
00089 }
00090

00092 //
00093 // Frustum::Inside                                      - Chapter 14, page 487
00094 //
00095 bool Frustum::Inside(const Vec3 &point) const
00096 {
00097         //for (int i=0; i<NumPlanes; ++i)
00098         for (int i=0; i<=Far; ++i)
00099         {
00100                 if (!m_Planes[i].Inside(point))
00101                         return false;
00102         }
00103 
00104         return true;
00105 }

00108 //
00109 // Frustum::Frustum                                     - Chapter 14, page 488
00110 //
00111 bool Frustum::Inside(const Vec3 &point, const float radius) const
00112 {
00113         for(int i = 0; i < NumPlanes; ++i) 
00114         {       
00115                 if (!m_Planes[i].Inside(point, radius))
00116                         return false;
00117         }       
00118         
00119         // otherwise we are fully in view
00120         return(true);
00121 }
00122 
00123 //
00124 // Frustum::Frustum                                     - Chapter 14, page 488
00125 //
00126 void Frustum::Init(const float fov, const float aspect, const float nearClip, const float farClip)
00127 {
00128         m_Fov = fov;
00129         m_Aspect = aspect;
00130         m_Near = nearClip;
00131         m_Far = farClip;
00132 
00133         double tanFovOver2 = tan(m_Fov/2.0f);
00134         Vec3 nearRight = (m_Near * tanFovOver2) * m_Aspect * g_Right;
00135         Vec3 farRight = (m_Far * tanFovOver2) * m_Aspect * g_Right;
00136         Vec3 nearUp = (m_Near * tanFovOver2 ) * g_Up;
00137         Vec3 farUp = (m_Far * tanFovOver2)  * g_Up;
00138 
00139         // points start in the upper right and go around clockwise
00140         m_NearClip[0] = (m_Near * g_Forward) - nearRight + nearUp;
00141         m_NearClip[1] = (m_Near * g_Forward) + nearRight + nearUp;
00142         m_NearClip[2] = (m_Near * g_Forward) + nearRight - nearUp;
00143         m_NearClip[3] = (m_Near * g_Forward) - nearRight - nearUp;
00144 
00145         m_FarClip[0] = (m_Far * g_Forward) - farRight + farUp;
00146         m_FarClip[1] = (m_Far * g_Forward) + farRight + farUp;
00147         m_FarClip[2] = (m_Far * g_Forward) + farRight - farUp;
00148         m_FarClip[3] = (m_Far * g_Forward) - farRight - farUp;
00149 
00150         // now we have all eight points. Time to construct 6 planes.
00151         // the normals point away from you if you use counter clockwise verts.
00152 
00153         Vec3 origin(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00154         m_Planes[Near].Init(m_NearClip[2], m_NearClip[1], m_NearClip[0]);
00155         m_Planes[Far].Init(m_FarClip[0], m_FarClip[1], m_FarClip[2]);
00156         m_Planes[Right].Init(m_FarClip[2], m_FarClip[1], origin);
00157         m_Planes[Top].Init(m_FarClip[1], m_FarClip[0], origin);
00158         m_Planes[Left].Init(m_FarClip[0], m_FarClip[3], origin);
00159         m_Planes[Bottom].Init(m_FarClip[3], m_FarClip[2], origin);
00160 }
00161 
00162 /*
00163 void Frustum::Init(const Mat4x4 projection)
00164 {
00165         // This code was adapted from the original authored code.
00166         // The original code was authored by Gill Gribb and Klaus Hartman 
00167         // in the article "Fast Extraction of Viewing Frustum Planes from the 
00168         // World-View-Projection Matrix" and published on 
00169         // http://www2.ravensoft.com/users/ggribb/plane%20extraction.pdf
00170 
00171         // Left clipping plane
00172         p_planes[Left].a = projection._14 + projection._11;
00173         p_planes[Left].b = projection._24 + projection._21;
00174         p_planes[Left].c = projection._34 + projection._31;
00175         p_planes[Left].d = projection._44 + projection._41;
00176         // Right clipping plane
00177         p_planes[Right].a = projection._14 - projection._11;
00178         p_planes[Right].b = projection._24 - projection._21;
00179         p_planes[Right].c = projection._34 - projection._31;
00180         p_planes[Right].d = projection._44 - projection._41;
00181         // Top clipping plane
00182         p_planes[Top].a = projection._14 - projection._12;
00183         p_planes[Top].b = projection._24 - projection._22;
00184         p_planes[Top].c = projection._34 - projection._32;
00185         p_planes[Top].d = projection._44 - projection._42;
00186         // Bottom clipping plane
00187         p_planes[Bottom].a = projection._14 + projection._12;
00188         p_planes[Bottom].b = projection._24 + projection._22;
00189         p_planes[Bottom].c = projection._34 + projection._32;
00190         p_planes[Bottom].d = projection._44 + projection._42;
00191         // Near clipping plane
00192         p_planes[Near].a = projection._13;
00193         p_planes[Near].b = projection._23;
00194         p_planes[Near].c = projection._33;
00195         p_planes[Near].d = projection._43;
00196         // Far clipping plane
00197         p_planes[Far].a = projection._14 - projection._13;
00198         p_planes[Far].b = projection._24 - projection._23;
00199         p_planes[Far].c = projection._34 - projection._33;
00200         p_planes[Far].d = projection._44 - projection._43;
00201         // Normalize the plane equations, if requested
00202 
00203         if (normalize == true)
00204         {
00205                 NormalizePlane(p_planes[0]);
00206                 NormalizePlane(p_planes[1]);
00207                 NormalizePlane(p_planes[2]);
00208                 NormalizePlane(p_planes[3]);
00209                 NormalizePlane(p_planes[4]);
00210                 NormalizePlane(p_planes[5]);
00211         }
00212 }
00213 */

00217 //
00218 // Frustum::Render                                      - Chapter 14, page 489
00219 //
00220 void Frustum::Render()
00221 {
00222         COLORED_VERTEX verts[24];
00223         for (int i=0; i<8; ++i)
00224         {
00225                 verts[i].color = g_White;
00226         }
00227 
00228         for (int i=0; i<8; ++i)
00229         {
00230                 verts[i+8].color = g_Red;
00231         }
00232 
00233         for (int i=0; i<8; ++i)
00234         {
00235                 verts[i+16].color = g_Blue;
00236         }
00237 
00238 
00239         // Draw the near clip plane
00240         verts[0].position = m_NearClip[0];      verts[1].position = m_NearClip[1];
00241         verts[2].position = m_NearClip[1];      verts[3].position = m_NearClip[2];
00242         verts[4].position = m_NearClip[2];      verts[5].position = m_NearClip[3];
00243         verts[6].position = m_NearClip[3];      verts[7].position = m_NearClip[0];
00244 
00245         // Draw the far clip plane
00246         verts[8].position = m_FarClip[0];       verts[9].position = m_FarClip[1];
00247         verts[10].position = m_FarClip[1];      verts[11].position = m_FarClip[2];
00248         verts[12].position = m_FarClip[2];      verts[13].position = m_FarClip[3];
00249         verts[14].position = m_FarClip[3];      verts[15].position = m_FarClip[0];
00250 
00251         // Draw the edges between the near and far clip plane
00252         verts[16].position = m_NearClip[0];     verts[17].position = m_FarClip[0];
00253         verts[18].position = m_NearClip[1];     verts[19].position = m_FarClip[1];
00254         verts[20].position = m_NearClip[2];     verts[21].position = m_FarClip[2];
00255         verts[22].position = m_NearClip[3];     verts[23].position = m_FarClip[3];
00256 
00257         DWORD oldLightMode;
00258         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, &oldLightMode );
00259         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, FALSE );
00260 
00261     DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetFVF( COLORED_VERTEX::FVF );
00262         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->DrawPrimitiveUP( D3DPT_LINELIST, 12, verts, sizeof(COLORED_VERTEX) );
00263 
00264         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, oldLightMode );
00265 }
00266 
00267 bool TriangleIterator::InitializeStrippedMesh(LPDIRECT3DVERTEXBUFFER9 pVerts, int stride, int strips, int *triCountList )
00268 {
00269         char *pVertices = NULL;
00270         if( FAILED( pVerts->Lock( 0, 0, (void**)&pVertices, 0 ) ) )
00271         return false;
00272 
00273         for (int i=0; i<strips; ++i)
00274         {
00275                 m_Size += triCountList[i];
00276         }
00277 
00278         m_Triangles = GCC_NEW Vec3[m_Size * 3];
00279         int src = 0;
00280         int dest = 0;
00281 
00282         for (int strip=0; strip<strips; ++strip )
00283         {
00284                 int vertsInStrip = triCountList[strip]+2;
00285                 assert(vertsInStrip);
00286 
00287                 m_Triangles[dest] = *((Vec3*)&pVertices[stride * src]);
00288                 m_Triangles[dest+1] = *((Vec3*)&pVertices[stride * (src+1)]);
00289                 m_Triangles[dest+2] = *((Vec3*)&pVertices[stride * (src+2)]);
00290                 dest+=3;
00291                 src+=3;
00292                 for (int tri=1; tri<triCountList[strip]; ++tri)
00293                 {
00294                         // for every extra vertex in the triangle strip, you have to grab
00295                         // the two previous verts in the dest list, reverse them, and copy them
00296                         // forward. This will give you a triangle with the same winding
00297                         m_Triangles[dest] = m_Triangles[dest-1];
00298                         m_Triangles[dest+1] = m_Triangles[dest-2];
00299                         m_Triangles[dest+2] = *((Vec3*)&pVertices[stride * (++src)]);
00300                         dest+=3;
00301                 }
00302         }
00303         assert(dest==m_Size*3);
00304         pVerts->Unlock();
00305 
00306         return true;
00307 }
00308 
00309 void *TriangleIterator::VGet(unsigned int i) 
00310 {       
00311         assert(i<m_Size);
00312         return &m_Triangles[i*3]; 
00313 }
